data.title: Capturing other faction's MCV doesn't allow to build its vehicles (Playtest 20140711)
data.body:
I've tested the new playtest in a skirmish, soviets VS allies. After capturing the allies MCV, I could build allies buildings, allies infantry (after building allies barracks)

However, allies vehicles don't appear, even if I build a War Factory with only the allies MCV deployed, and the soviet one undeployed.

data.title: Wish: New lua functions
data.body:
- [x] 1) Trigger: void OnCaptured(Actor a, LuaFunction func)
- [x] 2) Trigger: void OnAnyKilled(LuaTable actors, LuaFunction func)
- [x] 3) Map: LuaTable ActorsInBox(WPos topleft, WPos bottomright, LuaFunction filter)
- [x] 4) Production: void SetRallyPoint(CPos location)
- [x] 5) Map: void PlaceBeacon(WPos location, Owner owner)
- [x] 6) Make actors blinking (this target flash thing) - Example: [Minute 5:32](http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=afzfD0AGTPQ)
- [ ] 7) Switch between battlefield control on-/offline/standby (like at the beginning of most ra2 missions)

data.title: D2K Additional Production Facilities
data.body: Could be wrong, but even up to 20140711 it seems that in D2K, building more barracks, war factories, etc. doesn't seem to increase the speed of unit production at all?

data.title: Restored PlaceBuilding order's ProductionQueue checks.
data.body:
Fixes regression in #5948 by restoring the currentItem
checks in the PlaceBuilding order to ensure that the production you are trying to deploy is still
valid at the time that you attempt to place the building.

I have tested and confirmed the fix, though I don't know what the original reasoning for removing the checks was in 4db2cf6.  It doesn't seem to have an effect on the capturable tech and race changes that were done.

data.title: Made Hijacker buildable by soviets
data.body: In order to fix #5950 .

data.title: Two crates at the same location
data.body:
If one crate is falling ontop of another,
the "neutral player" will get the crate action.

data.title: Fixed broken drop-zone maps
data.body:
Before you only got this "heal-action" from crates,
now the units are also available and the harv-bomber works.

But the terrian is still broken, I'll fix that later in another PR.

data.title: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (crate 303 (not in world))
data.body:
Tested ultra large maps (512x512) and played around with harvesters etc. Then i kept clicking nuke silo building and instantly sold it (so i get more space to my silos), while doing that, it crashed with error:

```
Red Alert Mod at Version release-20140608
Operating System: Windows (Microsoft Windows NT 6.1.7601 Service Pack 1)
Runtime Version: .NET CLR 4.0.30319.18444
Exception of type `System.InvalidOperationException`: Attempted to get trait from destroyed object (crate 303 (not in world))
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.CheckDestroyed(Actor actor)
   at OpenRA.TraitDictionary.Get[T](Actor actor)
   at OpenRA.Mods.RA.ParaDrop.Tick(Actor self)
   at OpenRA.World.<Tick>m__11B(TraitPair`1 x)
   at OpenRA.WorldUtils.DoTimed[T](IEnumerable`1 e, Action`1 a, String text)
   at OpenRA.World.Tick()
   at OpenRA.Game.TickInner(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Tick(OrderManager orderManager)
   at OpenRA.Game.Run()
   at OpenRA.Program.Run(String[] args)
   at OpenRA.Program.Main(String[] args)
```

![allieshijacker](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3565252/371a8f8c-0ab1-11e4-8183-8d790ee38f38.png)

data.title: REQUEST Different default installpath for playtest.
data.body:
I keep installing playtests over my release openRA install, why do they have the same default path?

Should install playtest under "C:\Program Files (x86)\OpenRA\OpenRA Playtest" or something like that.

I know its a minor thing but I figure it would be easy enough to change it right?

data.title: Canceling wall build while deploying gives refund and a free wall
data.body: Only tested in TD. If you are deploying sandbags/chain-link fence and right-click cancel the build, you can still build the wall and get a refund of the original cost.

data.title: openra accesses home directory when making docs
data.body:
The openra build fails under Gentoo, as openra tries to access the home folder of the compiling user (which is of course restricted).

```
>>> Emerging (1 of 1) games-strategy/openra-20140608
 * openra-20140608.tar.gz SHA256 SHA512 WHIRLPOOL size ;-) ...                                                                                                   [ ok ]
>>> Unpacking source...
>>> Source unpacked in /tmp/portage/games-strategy/openra-20140608/work
>>> Preparing source in /tmp/portage/games-strategy/openra-20140608/work/openra-20140608 ...
>>> Source prepared.
>>> Configuring source in /tmp/portage/games-strategy/openra-20140608/work/openra-20140608 ...
>>> Source configured.
>>> Compiling source in /tmp/portage/games-strategy/openra-20140608/work/openra-20140608 ...
make -j5 
CSC fixheader.exe
CSC OpenRA.Game.exe
CSC OpenRA.Renderer.Sdl2.dll
CSC OpenRA.Renderer.Null.dll
CSC OpenRA.Lint.exe
CSC OpenRA.Irc.dll
CSC OpenRA.Utility.exe
CSC mods/ra/OpenRA.Mods.RA.dll
CSC mods/cnc/OpenRA.Mods.Cnc.dll
CSC mods/ts/OpenRA.Mods.TS.dll
CSC mods/d2k/OpenRA.Mods.D2k.dll
make -j5 native-dependencies 
make -j5 docs 

Unhandled Exception:
System.UnauthorizedAccessException: Access to the path "/var/lib/portage/.openra" is denied.
  at System.IO.Directory.CreateDirectoriesInternal (System.String path) [0x0006c] in /tmp/portage/dev-lang/mono-3.2.8/work/mono-3.2.8/mcs/class/corlib/System.IO/Directory.cs:116 
  at System.IO.Directory.CreateDirectory (System.String path) [0x000a4] in /tmp/portage/dev-lang/mono-3.2.8/work/mono-3.2.8/mcs/class/corlib/System.IO/Directory.cs:80 
  at OpenRA.Platform.get_SupportDir () [0x00099] in /tmp/portage/games-strategy/openra-20140608/work/openra-20140608/OpenRA.Game/Platform.cs:91 
  at OpenRA.Utility.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0004d] in /tmp/portage/games-strategy/openra-20140608/work/openra-20140608/OpenRA.Utility/Program.cs:45 
[ERROR] FATAL UNHANDLED EXCEPTION: System.UnauthorizedAccessException: Access to the path "/var/lib/portage/.openra" is denied.
  at System.IO.Directory.CreateDirectoriesInternal (System.String path) [0x0006c] in /tmp/portage/dev-lang/mono-3.2.8/work/mono-3.2.8/mcs/class/corlib/System.IO/Directory.cs:116 
  at System.IO.Directory.CreateDirectory (System.String path) [0x000a4] in /tmp/portage/dev-lang/mono-3.2.8/work/mono-3.2.8/mcs/class/corlib/System.IO/Directory.cs:80 
  at OpenRA.Platform.get_SupportDir () [0x00099] in /tmp/portage/games-strategy/openra-20140608/work/openra-20140608/OpenRA.Game/Platform.cs:91 
  at OpenRA.Utility.Program.Main (System.String[] args) [0x0004d] in /tmp/portage/games-strategy/openra-20140608/work/openra-20140608/OpenRA.Utility/Program.cs:45 
Makefile:295: recipe for target 'docs' failed
make: *** [docs] Error 1
 * ERROR: games-strategy/openra-20140608 failed (compile phase):
 *   emake failed
 * 
```

When compinling openra, it should not write anywhere except its build directory.

data.title: Added some trait [Desc()]s.
1434 players map; 2fps map preview
data.body:
Just messing around, not to be taken seriously:

![](http://i2.minus.com/iZRUgU1iIyMr7.png)

I was surprised this didnt crash... no exceptions!'

But im still surprised how laggy it is to draw 1434 players. Actually even with just 800 players it lagged almost as much. Is it updating the screen every player spot draw call?

data.title: Add a chat tab for spectator-only messaging
data.body: Like team chat but for spectators so they can talk about the game and it would not be visible to players.

data.title: Fieldloader and non-public fields
data.body: This makes the serializers able to use private fields. See the first commit's message for details. The third commit makes them able to use TypeConverters, when available.

data.title: Load replay data on demand
data.body: After a while of playing openra and gathering lots of replay files, the replay menu starts to take a considerable amount of time to open. Is this because the meta data of all the replay files are loaded before the menu is displayed? If so, would it be better to read this data only when required by the user interface? So read the meta data of files as the user scrolls down in the list for example, or when he applies a filter.

data.title: Added MaxSpread for more control over maximum area of damage
data.body:
This implements the more important part of #5436.

So far, it's only used to make the Ion Cannon more powerful without increasing the area of effect.

data.title: Fixed unbuildable high-tech on Fort Lonestar
data.body: Followup of https://github.com/OpenRA/OpenRA/pull/5759/.

data.title: Sea & Cake map bug
data.body:
In the top left tiberium field of Sea & Cake, the tiberium seems to grow into an inaccessible tile at the very top left of the field (I assume?) causing the harvester to sit there. When ordered back, the harvester behaves as normal, but left to it's own devices, returns to sit at that spot.

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1812087/3560300/c353679e-0962-11e4-9011-db65a5e092ef.png)

data.title: Fixed a bug in Fort Lonestar
data.body: Fixed 2) and 3) from #5933.

data.title: Implements more sophisticated explosion animation/sound system
data.body: Explosions can now use different art for various situations (ground, water, air, ground target hit, water target hit, air target hit).

data.title: Fort Lonestar bugs
data.body:
Found some thinks, which I belive to be bugs.
1) Missile silo and concrete wall are shown, but not buildable:
![fortlonestartfail5](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3553173/b86d5d9c-0900-11e4-9794-7df258ddf6f4.png)

2) At 0:50 the patrol is not spawned at the borders of the map:
0:49 ![fortlonestartfail4a](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3553208/3e4cc84e-0901-11e4-81f2-19c562d2ed90.png)
0:50 ![fortlonestartfail4b](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3553209/3e7b59ca-0901-11e4-9d24-7e2627cae8fd.png)
0:52 ![fortlonestartfail4c](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3553213/446e7fce-0901-11e4-9ec7-9fc4ab23fc63.png)

3) The enemies are staying around in empty corners:
![fortlonestartfail3](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3553266/9fd3b83e-0901-11e4-9f11-61e1a423d1b0.png)

Finally, when I first tryed the map, some guys were staying around at their spawns.
But I can't reproduce that anymore...
![fortlonestartfail2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3553287/d8bb0832-0901-11e4-8176-989d4e1f39bd.png)
![fortlonestartfail1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7704140/3553291/dcd7298c-0901-11e4-984b-767dddc2fea6.png)

If that are bugs, I would like to do the fixes.

data.body: I added Barrel Explode death weapon to Oil Derricks. They damages nearby units on death like RA2.
